TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IRangeValueProvider

Docs.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that can be set to a value within a range.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Implemented on a UI Automation provider that must support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern> control pattern.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the value of a control is read-only.
Docs.value: if the value is read-only; if it can be modified.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows an implementation of this method for a control that is not read-only.
[!code-csharp[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#IsReadOnly](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/CSharp/RangeValueFragment.cs#isreadonly)] [!code-vb[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#IsReadOnly](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/visualbasic/rangevaluefragment.vb#isreadonly)]

Docs.summary: Gets the value that is added to or subtracted from the property when a large change is made, such as with the PAGE DOWN key.
Docs.value: The large-change value supported by the control or null ( in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]) if the control does not support .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows an implementation of this method for a control that has a large change value of 5.0.
[!code-csharp[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#LargeChange](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/CSharp/RangeValueFragment.cs#largechange)] [!code-vb[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#LargeChange](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/visualbasic/rangevaluefragment.vb#largechange)]

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum range value supported by the control.
Docs.value: The maximum value supported by the control or null ( in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]) if the control does not support .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows an implementation of this method for a control that has a maximum value of 255.0.
[!code-csharp[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#Maximum](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/CSharp/RangeValueFragment.cs#maximum)] [!code-vb[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#Maximum](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/visualbasic/rangevaluefragment.vb#maximum)]

Docs.summary: Gets the minimum range value supported by the control.
Docs.value: The minimum value supported by the control or null ( in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]) if the control does not support .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows an implementation of this method for a control that has a minimum value of 0.0.
[!code-csharp[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#Minimum](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/CSharp/RangeValueFragment.cs#minimum)] [!code-vb[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#Minimum](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/visualbasic/rangevaluefragment.vb#minimum)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetValue(float64 value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the value of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The actual value set depends on the control implementation. The control may round the requested `value` up or down.
## Examples The following example shows one possible implementation of this method for a custom control. The custom control displays its range value through the alpha value of its base color.
[!code-csharp[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#SetValue](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/CSharp/RangeValueFragment.cs#setvalue)] [!code-vb[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#SetValue](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/visualbasic/rangevaluefragment.vb#setvalue)]

Docs.exception: When is less than the minimum or greater than the maximum value of the control.

Docs.summary: Gets the value that is added to or subtracted from the property when a small change is made, such as with an arrow key.
Docs.value: The small-change value or null ( in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]) if the control does not support .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows an implementation of this method for a control that has a small change value of 1.0.
[!code-csharp[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#SmallChange](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/CSharp/RangeValueFragment.cs#smallchange)] [!code-vb[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#SmallChange](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/visualbasic/rangevaluefragment.vb#smallchange)]

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the control.
Docs.value: The value of the control or null ( in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]) if the control does not support .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows an implementation of this method for a custom control. For the purposes of this sample, the custom control displays the value through the alpha setting of its base color.
[!code-csharp[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#Value](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/CSharp/RangeValueFragment.cs#value)] [!code-vb[UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip#Value](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAIRangeValueProvider_snip/visualbasic/rangevaluefragment.vb#value)]
